text: Hi <@UP4QRQFFU> So we are shortly going to start work on building a membership site if someone choses to pay their annual fees by invoice we would want to generate a quote automatically and email it to them.
If you are doing work on the Quotes system, someway to connect to the stripe integration in test mode would also be a great help during dev
you can pass `access_token` to the endpoint

We at Supermetrics want to use Quotes API to pull data out for reporting and analysis. Typical use case would be someone doing digital marketing and wanting to combine marketing data coming from e.g. Facebook Ads or LinkedIn Ads with data about quotes from HubSpot.

Hi <@U012W4YEUTX>, I am not sure if I understand your question correctly. We found the information from the Quotes API documentation <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/quotes>

And same is also said on the HubSpot Community: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Scope-Get-one-Quotes-Line-item-Product/td-p/326898>

For us the biggest problem right now is that the CRM API currently only supports retrieving quotes that have been created by a HubSpot user in a HubSpot account *via an API key*. And that is not viable option for us. We would need the support for *OAuth authorization*.
Thanks but what about the redirect URL?any idea about it

Hi everyone,
I wanted to migrate the web traffic HubSpot analytics data into the SQL server. So have tried using the Analytics API but got a permission error. (Should have the enterprise account access).
Also tried to fetch the HubSpot analytics data using OAuth connection but couldn't do it.
Is there any other way we can fetch the HubSpot analytics data except the manual export option?.
 
Can we able to integrate the HubSpot analytics data into google analytics and then migrate it to SQL server?.
 
Looking for some suggestions or help on this issue.
Will be glad if anyone has done this before or any suggestions are welcome.
redirect url?

Hey *for anyone using Postman* -- possibly a novice question, but any easy way to auto-trigger repeat calls to "page through" all results?  I'm just trying to execute a one-time data pull, _not_ code this call into a server-side process, so just looking to facilitate this from a hand-triggered Postman call.  I've got ~24K contacts that I'm trying to pull field history for using <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/lists/get_list_contacts|this "get contacts in list" API call>, but I can only get 100 contacts per request.  Hoping to auto-resubmit the request while the JSON results contain `"has-more": true`, while also automatically updating the vid-offset value for the next call from what is provided in the last set of results:
    `"has-more": true,`
    `"vid-offset": 82361122`

I know there are some options using "Pre-request scripts" but couldn't get it to work as I expected.  Some related discussion I found, not specific to HubSpot API, but for Postman: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/53762496/using-postman-to-get-all-pages-in-a-paginated-response>
<@U01MBAU8KU1> interesting, let me dig into that and report back.

Hi there! We’re using the API to submit forms, but we’ve hit the 1000 entries limit. We only use this specific form to create new contacts (with a pop-up on our front-end), so I’ve thought about migrating this feature from the Forms API to the Contacts API. However, the documentation clearly states that the Contact API is designed for offline contacts. It suggests using the Forms API for online forms, which is logical, I guess. How can we overcome this 1000 entries limit, or what other API should we use?
Did you solve this? Just use the filters in the search api and select company name equal to your value

`"filters":[`
            `{`
                `"propertyName": "name",`
                `"operator": "EQ",`
                `"value": "yourvalue"]`
            `}`
that's correct, when an app is installed it's available for the account. the user who installs the app needs to have all of the permissions that the app requires to grant it access.
Their tutorial does a great job at explaining how to implement OAuth <https://developers.HubSpot.com/en/docs-beta/idea-tracker-tutorial-part-1>

Hello :wave:  Am I the only one who missed the good old days when HubSpot was auto setting value for property options to lowcase/underscore/no special character. Now users create options and it is the same as the Label by default... As a result, it throws errors when you use the right value with a special character :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

```{
   "isValid":false,
   "message":"Interfaces Personnalisées was not one of the allowed options: [label:  'Action ' value:  'Action ' display_order: 0 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'Assistant ' value:  'Assistant ' display_order: 1 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'Contact ' value:  'Contact ' display_order: 2 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'Feuille de temps ' value:  'Feuille de temps ' display_order: 3 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'Groupe de t303242ches ' value:  'Groupe de t303242ches ' display_order: 4 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'Horaires de travail ' value:  'Horaires de travail ' display_order: 5 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'Interfaces personnalis303251es ' value:  'Interfaces personnalis303251es ' display_order: 6 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'Messages ' value:  'Messages ' display_order: 7 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'PLight ' value:  'PLight ' display_order: 8 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'Paiements ' value:  'Paiements ' display_order: 9 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'Planification ' value:  'Planification ' display_order: 10 hidden: false read_only: false , label:  'T303242ches li303251es ' value:  'T303242ches li303251es ' display_order: 11 hidden: false read_only: false ]",
   "error":"INVALID_OPTION",
   "name":"modules_extra_progressionlive"
},```
can I use Express.js inside serverless function?
Hey <@UJJCWR8JU>, did you ever get a solution for this?

<@U01G7D8SV42> I actually did find a solution for this.  I had a paid subscription to zapier (you can get it for free) and I used the webhooks to do the updates. I had an employee doing them one by one, took them hours and they made mistakes that made Sales angry.  Using a Google sheet, zapier and a webhook zap the employee now does hundreds in a few minutes. You dont really need any development code and pretty easy once you look at the api guide.
Awesome. Thanks for the reply. I’m actually looking around for an answer for someone in another channel who needs to do this, so I’ll pass this info back to them.
if you have any more info, like the guide you’re referring to or the zaps you used, let me know. thanks

You can dm me, I can get them some screenshoots of what was done on our side. No charge, upsell or funny business. This gave me so much pain. I noticed I said she on the original post and he in the response. Yep the old employee left and she referenced this pain as one of the resons.
Just x-posted this in <#C011F74BKQW|serverless-functions> too :slightly_smiling_face:
At least they updated it so that it would no longer update the internal value if you later came back and edited  the label  of an option (I'm _pretty sure_ this was the case for a while)

I think this limit may only apply on a per-contact basis -- i.e., a single contact can't indiividually have more than 1000 form submissions -- see here: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/contact-and-form-limits>

Perhaps you've only hit the limit due to testing with the same contact?

I do believe there are overall limits on API calls based on your HubSpot product subscription levels, but 1000 seems pretty low on the Portal-level unless you are working with a fairly basic subscription.
Scroll down to "Technical Limits & Definitions" here for overall API call limits: <https://legal.HubSpot.com/HubSpot-product-and-services-catalog>
